intro: Lampranthus profundus, commonly known as the deep-rooted ice plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range from pink to purple, bloom in late summer and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Lampranthus profundus is drought-tolerant and well-suited for xeriscaping due to its ability to store water in its thick leaves.
